Hi everybody,

my question concerns a different approach of writing tests. I'm in the
unfortunate situation of having to write tests for an existing
application(I haven't been involved in the development). 

I found tons of information about test-driven development and
test-first, but hardly anything about writing tests after the
application has been developed. Any experiences? 

It still isn't determined yet on which level the tests should take
place. "Real unit-tests" ("test everything that could possibly break")
would be too much work for the given time(~6 weeks), I guess. So it
might be more something like acceptance tests. 

The SUT is a middleware-API running on an application server, using
webservices and RMI to get and set customer data from several remote
databases (lots of getters for about 10mio customers). => no user
interface/gui etc. 

Since we still have to exactly figure out what we want to test, I
would appreciate some information about whether or not JUnit is the
right choice in general (alternatives?) and some advices for my "test
last" approach. 

Thanks in advance,
Thomas
